basics.name: Smail Ait Bouhsain
basics.label: AI Research Scientist, PhD
basics.summary: PhD in AI and Robotics with publications in top-tier conferences and real-world R&D experience. Expertise in Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Embodied Perception, and Robotics. Strong software background in Python, C/C++, and PyTorch.

work.name: National Institute for Research in Digital Science (Inria)
work.summary: Developing 3D-VLMs for embodied perception and reasoning.

work.name: Logitech
work.summary: Developed multimodal deep learning models for emotion recognition in streamers; improved performance via multimodality fusion.

work.name: OCP Group
work.summary: Designed a high-fidelity autonomous mining truck simulation and implemented planning and control algorithms.

work.name: VITA-Lab, EPFL
work.summary: Research on pedestrian future position and intention prediction for autonomous vehicles; published and outperformed prior work.

education.summary: Thesis: Deep Learning Methods for Multi-Robot Task and Motion Planning / Embodied Perception and Planning. Jury praised originality and real-world impact; recommended for a European PhD prize.
Major: Intelligent Systems, ML and Robotics. Minor: Management of Technology.

projects.name: 3D-VLMs for Embodied Perception
projects.summary: Research and development of 3D vision-language models for embodied perception and reasoning.

projects.name: AI-Based Robot Task and Motion Planning
projects.summary: Graph Neural Network-based geometric reasoning methods for robot task and motion planning (LAAS-CNRS).

projects.name: Multimodal Emotion Recognition
projects.summary: Multimodal deep learning models combining video, audio and physiological signals for emotion recognition (Logitech).

projects.name: Autonomous Mining Truck
projects.summary: High-fidelity ROS simulation and planning/control algorithms for autonomous mining trucks (OCP Group).

publications.name: Graph Neural Network-Based Geometric Reasoning for Robot Task and Motion Planning
publications.summary: GNN-based geometric reasoning methods applied to task and motion planning for robots.

publications.name: Generalizing CNN-Based Feasibility Prediction to Multi-Robot Manipulation of Complex Objects

publications.name: Recurrent-Neural Networks for Uncertainty Prediction in Robust Motion Planning

publications.name: Multi-task Convolutional Neural Networks for Joint Action and Grasp Feasibility Prediction
publications.summary: Multi-task CNNs for predicting action and grasp feasibility in robotic manipulation.
